text: WAC 246-XXX-001 Purpose and applicability of chapter.
label: HH1

text: This chapter is adopted by the Washington state department
label: BODY

text: of health to implement chapter 70.230 RCW and establish
label: BODY

text: minimum health and safety requirements for the licensing,
label: BODY

text: inspection, operation, maintenance, and construction of
label: BODY

text: ambulatory surgical facilities.

text: (1) Compliance with the regulations in this chapter
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: applicable federal, state and local codes and ordinances.

text: WAC 246-XXX-010 Definitions.

text: For the purposes of this chapter and chapter 70.230 RCW,
label: BODY

text: the following words and phrases will have the following
label: BODY

text: meanings unless the context clearly indicates otherwise:

label: BODY

text: indicating the health, welfare, and safety of the patient
label: BODY

text: is harmed:
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: result in bodily injury or death.

label: BODY

text: harassment, or other actions which may result in emotional
label: BODY

text: or behavioral stress or injury.
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: individual so licensed under chapter 18.79 RCW.

label: BODY

text: report on serious reportable events in health care.

label: BODY

text: whether physical, chemical, or biological, capable of

text: WAC 246-XXX-020 Department Responsibilities –
label: HH1

text: Licensing, Change of Ownership – Adjudicative Proceeding.
label: HH1

text: This section outlines the actions and roles of the
label: BODY

text: department for licensing an ambulatory surgical facility.
label: BODY

text: Page 8
label: BODY

text: (1) Before issuing an initial license to facilities
label: BODY

text: that exist prior to July 1, 2009, the department will
label: BODY

text: verify compliance with chapter 70.230 RCW and this chapter
label: BODY

text: by:
label: BODY

text: (a) Receipt and approval of the initial license
label: BODY

text: application;
label: BODY

text: (b) Receipt of the correct licensing fee;
label: BODY

text: (c) Receipt of a completed and accepted inspection
label: BODY

text: conducted by:
label: BODY

text: (i) The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services;
label: BODY

text: (ii) The Joint Commission;
label: BODY

text: (iii) The Accreditation Association for Ambulatory
label: BODY

text: Health Care;
label: BODY

text: (iv) The American Association for Accreditation of
label: BODY

text: Ambulatory Surgery Facilities; or
label: BODY

text: (d) For facilities that have not been inspected by
label: BODY

text: Medicare or one of the accrediting organizations listed in
label: BODY

text: (c) the following:
label: BODY

text: (i) Receipt of a certificate of need, when needed, as
label: BODY

text: provided in chapter 70.38 RCW;
label: BODY

text: (ii) Receipt of a certificate of occupancy by the
label: BODY

text: local jurisdiction;
label: BODY

text: (iii) Receipt of the ambulatory surgical facility’s
label: BODY

text: safety and emergency training program; and
label: BODY

text: (iv) Successfully completing an on-site licensing
label: BODY

text: inspection conducted by the department.
label: BODY

text: (2) Before issuing an initial license after July 1,
label: BODY

text: 2009, the department will verify compliance with chapter
label: BODY

text: 70.230 RCW and this chapter including, but is not limited
label: BODY

text: to:
label: BODY

text: (a) Approval of construction documents in accordance
label: BODY

text: with this chapter;
label: BODY

text: (b) Receipt of a certificate, when needed, as provided
label: BODY

text: in chapter 70.38 RCW;
label: BODY

text: (c) Receipt and approval of the initial license
label: BODY

text: application;
label: BODY

text: (d) Receipt of the correct license fee;
label: BODY

text: (e) Receipt of the ambulatory surgical facility’s
label: BODY

text: safety and emergency training program; and
label: BODY

text: (f) Receipt of a completed and accepted inspection
label: BODY

text: conducted by:
label: BODY

text: (i) The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services;

text: (ii) The Joint Commission;
label: BODY

text: (iii) The Accreditation Association for Ambulatory

text: Health Care;

text: Ambulatory Surgery Facilities; or

text: (3) Before reissuing a license, the department will:

text: (a) Approve the amended ambulatory surgical facility
label: BODY

text: application form; and

text: (b) Confirm receipt of the correct fee.

text: (4) Before issuing a change of ownership license, the
label: BODY

text: department will:

text: (a) Approve the change of ownership application,

text: (c) Confirm the change of ownership will not alter the

text: certificate of need status or require a certificate of need

text: require a construction review or on-site inspection. A

label: BODY

text: need review and approval per RCW 70.38.

text: (5) The department may issue a provisional license to
label: BODY

text: allow the operation of an ambulatory surgical facility, if

text: the department determines that the applicant or licensed

text: ambulatory surgical facility failed to comply with chapter
label: BODY

text: 70.230 RCW or this chapter.
label: BODY

text: (6) The department may deny, suspend, modify, or
label: BODY

text: revoke a license when it finds an applicant or ambulatory
label: BODY

text: surgical facility has failed or refused to comply with
label: BODY

text: chapter 70.230 RCW or this chapter. The department’s notice
label: BODY

text: of a license denial, suspension, modification, or
label: BODY

text: revocation will be consistent with RCW 43.70.115. The

text: proceeding is governed by the Administrative Procedure Act

text: applicant or license holder has the right to an

text: described in subsection 100(4)(c) of this chapter.

text: (1) Surveys. The department will:

text: (a) Conduct on-site surveys of each ambulatory
label: BODY

text: WAC 246-XXX-130 Adverse Events.  For the purpose of
label: HH1

text: this sub-section, “serious disability” means a physical or

text: mental impairment that substantially limits the major life
label: BODY

text: activities of a patient.
label: BODY

label: BODY

text: (1) Notify the department whenever any of the
label: BODY

text: following adverse events have occurred:

text: (a) Surgery performed on the wrong body part;
label: BODY

text: patient after surgery or other procedure;

text: (e) Intraoperative or immediately post-operative death
label: BODY

text: in an ASA Class 1 patient;

text: (f) Patient death or serious disability associated
label: BODY

text: with the use of contaminated drugs, devices, or biologics

text: provided by the healthcare facility;

label: BODY

text: with the use or function of a device in patient care in

text: which the device is used or functions other than as
label: BODY

text: intended;

text: serious disability, while being cared for in a healthcare

text: facility;

text: WAC 246-XXX-150 Management of information.  The
label: HH1

text: purpose of this section is to improve patient outcomes and
label: BODY

text: ambulatory surgical facility performance through obtaining,
label: BODY

text: managing, and use of information.
label: BODY

text: An ambulatory surgical facility must:
label: BODY

text: (1) Provide medical staff, employees and other
label: BODY

text: authorized persons with access to patient information
label: BODY

text: systems, resources, and services;
label: BODY

text: (2) Maintain confidentiality, security, and integrity
label: BODY

text: of information;
label: BODY

text: (3) Initiate and maintain a medical record for every
label: BODY

text: patient assessed or treated including a process to review
label: BODY

text: records for completeness, accuracy, and timeliness.
label: BODY

text: (4) Create medical records that:
label: BODY

text: (a) Identify the patient;
label: BODY

text: (b) Have clinical data to support the diagnosis,
label: BODY

text: Page 20
label: BODY

text: course and results of treatment for the patient;
label: BODY

text: (c) Have signed consent documents;
label: BODY

text: (d) Promote continuity of care;
label: BODY

text: (e) Have accurately written, signed, dated, and timed
label: BODY

text: entries;
label: BODY

text: (f) Indicates authentication after the record is
label: BODY

text: transcribed;
label: BODY

text: (g) Are promptly filed, accessible, and retained
label: BODY

text: according to chapter 5.46 RCW; and
label: BODY

text: (h) Include verbal orders that are accepted and
label: BODY

text: transcribed by qualified personnel;
label: BODY

text: (5) Establish a systematic method for identifying each
label: BODY

text: medical record, identification of service area, filing, and
label: BODY

text: retrieval of all patient's records; and
label: BODY

text: (6) Adopt and implement policies and procedures that
label: BODY

text: address:
label: BODY

text: (a) Who has access to and release of confidential
label: BODY

text: medical records according to chapter 70.02 RCW;
label: BODY

text: (b) Retention and preservation of medical records;
label: BODY

text: (c) Transmittal of medical data to ensure continuity
label: BODY

text: of care; and
label: BODY

text: (d) Exclusion of clinical evidence from the medical
label: BODY

text: record.
label: BODY

text: WAC 246-XXX-155 Coordinated Quality Improvement
label: HH1

text: Program.  The purpose of this section is to ensure the
label: HH1

text: establishment and on-going maintenance of a coordinated
label: BODY

text: quality improvement program. The intent is to improve the
label: BODY

text: quality of health care services provided to patients and to
label: BODY

text: identify and prevent medical malpractice.
label: BODY

text: An ambulatory surgical facility must:
label: BODY

text: (1) Have a facility-wide approach to process design
label: BODY

text: and performance measurement, assessment, and improving
label: BODY

text: patient care services according to RCW 70.230.080
label: BODY

text: including, but not limited to:
label: BODY

text: (a) A written performance improvement plan that is
label: BODY

text: periodically evaluated;
label: BODY

text: (b) Performance improvement activities which are
label: BODY

text: interdisciplinary and include at least one member of the
label: BODY

text: governing authority;
label: BODY

text: (c) Prioritize performance improvement activities;
label: BODY

text: (d) Implement and monitor actions taken to improve
label: BODY

text: performance;
label: BODY

text: (e) Education programs dealing with performance
label: BODY

text: improvement, patient safety, medication errors, injury
label: BODY

text: Page 21
label: BODY

text: prevention; and
label: BODY

text: (f) Review serious or unanticipated patient outcomes
label: BODY

text: in a timely manner;
label: BODY

text: (2) Systematically collect, measure and assess data on
label: BODY

text: processes and outcomes related to patient care and
label: BODY

text: organization functions.
label: BODY

text: (3) Collect, measure and assess data including, but
label: BODY

text: not limited to:
label: BODY

text: (a) Operative, other invasive, and noninvasive
label: BODY

text: procedures that place patients at risk;
label: BODY

text: (b) Infection rates, pathogen distributions and
label: BODY

text: antimicrobial susceptibility profiles;
label: BODY

text: (c) Death;
label: BODY

text: (d) Medication management or administration related to
label: BODY

text: wrong medication, wrong dose, wrong time, near misses and
label: BODY

text: any other medication errors and incidents;
label: BODY

text: (e) Injuries, falls; restraint use; negative health
label: BODY

text: outcomes and incidents injurious to patients in the
label: BODY

text: ambulatory surgical facility;
label: BODY

text: (f) Adverse events listed in WAC 246-XXX-130;
label: BODY

text: (g) Discrepancies or patterns between preoperative and
label: BODY

text: postoperative (including pathologic) diagnosis, including
label: BODY

text: pathologic review of specimens removed during surgical or
label: BODY

text: invasive procedures;
label: BODY

text: (h) Adverse drug reactions (as defined by the
label: BODY

text: ambulatory surgical facility);
label: BODY

text: (i) Confirmed transfusion reactions;
label: BODY

text: (j) Patient grievances, needs, expectations, and
label: BODY

text: satisfaction; and
label: BODY

text: (k) Quality control and risk management activities.
label: BODY

text: WAC 246-320-176 Infection control program.  The
label: HH1

text: purpose of this section is to identify and reduce the risk
label: BODY

text: of acquiring and transmitting infections and communicable
label: BODY

text: diseases between patients, employees, medical staff,
label: BODY

text: volunteers, and visitors. An ambulatory surgical facility
label: BODY

text: must:
label: BODY

text: (1) Develop, implement and maintain a written
label: BODY

text: infection control and surveillance program;
label: BODY

text: (2) Designate staff to:
label: BODY

text: (a) Manage the activities of the infection control
label: BODY

text: program;
label: BODY

text: (b) Assure the infection control program conforms with
label: BODY

text: patient care and safety policies and procedures; and
label: BODY

text: (c) Provide consultation on the infection control
label: BODY

text: program, policies and procedures throughout the entire
label: BODY

text: Page 22
label: BODY

text: facility;
label: BODY

text: (3) Ensure staff managing the infection control
label: BODY

text: program have:
label: BODY

text: (a) A minimum of two years experience in a health
label: BODY

text: related field; and
label: BODY

text: (b) Training in the principles and practices of
label: BODY

text: infection control;
label: BODY

text: (4) Develop and implement infection control policies
label: BODY

text: and procedures consistent with the guidelines of the
label: BODY

text: centers for disease control and prevention (CDC).
label: BODY

text: (5) Assure the infection control policies and
label: BODY

text: procedures address, but are not limited to the following:
label: BODY

text: (a) Routine surveillance, outbreak investigations and
label: BODY

text: interventions including pathogen distributions and
label: BODY

text: antimicrobial susceptibility profiles consistent with the
label: BODY

text: 2006 CDC healthcare infection control practices advisory
label: BODY

text: committee guideline, Management of Multidrug-Resistant
label: BODY

text: Organisms in Healthcare Settings;
label: BODY

text: (b) Patient care practices in all clinical care areas;
label: BODY

text: (c) Receipt, use, disposal, sterilizing, processing,
label: BODY

text: or reuse of equipment to prevent disease transmission;
label: BODY

text: (d) Preventing cross contamination of soiled and clean
label: BODY

text: items during sorting, processing, transporting, and
label: BODY

text: storage;
label: BODY

text: (e) Environmental management and housekeeping
label: BODY

text: functions;
label: BODY

text: (f) Approving and properly using disinfectants,
label: BODY

text: equipment, and sanitation procedures;
label: BODY

text: (g) Cleaning areas used for surgical procedures
label: BODY

text: before, between, and after use;
label: BODY

text: (h) Facility-wide daily and periodic cleaning;
label: BODY

text: (i) Occupational health consistent with current
label: BODY

text: practice;
label: BODY

text: (j) Attire;
label: BODY

text: (k) Traffic patterns;
label: BODY

text: (l) Antisepsis;
label: BODY

text: (m) Hand washing;
label: BODY

text: (n) Scrub technique and surgical preparation;
label: BODY

text: (o) Biohazardous waste management according to
label: BODY

text: applicable federal, state, and local regulations;
label: BODY

text: (p) Barrier, transmission and isolation precautions;
label: BODY

text: and
label: BODY

text: (q) Pharmacy and therapeutics;
label: BODY

text: (6) Establish and implement a plan for:
label: BODY

text: (a) Reporting communicable diseases including cluster
label: BODY

text: or outbreaks of post-operative infections according to
label: BODY

text: chapter 246-100 WAC; and
label: BODY

text: Page 23
label: BODY

text: (b) Surveying and investigating communicable disease
label: BODY

text: occurrences in the ambulatory surgical facility consistent
label: BODY

text: with WAC 246-100; and
label: BODY

text: (c) Collecting, measuring and assessing data on
label: BODY

text: infection rates, pathogen distributions and antimicrobial
label: BODY

text: susceptibility profiles
label: BODY

text: WAC 246-XXX-199 Fees – License, Survey, Change of
label: HH1

text: Ownership, Refund Process.  This section establishes the
label: HH1

text: license, survey, and change of ownership fees, a late
label: BODY

text: penalty fee and request for refund of an initial fee.
label: BODY

text: (1) Initial License. Applicants for an initial license
label: BODY

text: must send the department:
label: BODY

text: (a) An initial license fee of two hundred dollars; and
label: BODY

text: (b) An initial survey fee based on the number of known
label: BODY

text: or expected annual visits as follows;
label: BODY

text: (i) One thousand two hundred dollars for under 1000
label: BODY

text: annual patient visits;
label: BODY

text: (ii) One thousand six hundred dollars for 1001 to 5000
label: BODY

text: annual patient visits; or
label: BODY

text: (iii)  Two thousand two hundred dollars for more than
label: BODY

text: 5000 annual patient visits.
label: BODY

text: (2) Renewal License. Licensees must send the
label: BODY

text: department a license renewal and survey fee at least 30
label: BODY

text: days before the license expiration date as follows:
label: BODY

text: (a) One thousand three hundred dollars for under 1000
label: BODY

text: annual patient visits;
label: BODY

text: (b) One thousand seven hundred dollars for 1001 to
label: BODY

text: 5000 annual patient visits; or
label: BODY

text: (c) Two thousand three hundred dollars for more than
label: BODY

text: 5000 annual patient visits.
label: BODY

text: (3) Late Fee. A licensee must send the department a
label: BODY

text: late fee in the amount of twenty-five dollars per day, not
label: BODY

text: to exceed five hundred dollars, whenever the renewal fee is
label: BODY

text: not paid by 30 days before the license expiration (date as
label: BODY

text: indicated by the postmark).
label: BODY

text: (4) Change of Ownership. The person purchasing or
label: BODY

text: taking over ownership of a licensed ambulatory surgical
label: BODY

text: facility must:
label: BODY

text: (a) Send the department a change of ownership fee in
label: BODY

text: the amount of two hundred fifty dollars. The fee is paid
label: BODY

text: thirty days before the change of ownership becomes final;
label: BODY

text: and
label: BODY

text: (b) Receive from the department a new license valid
label: BODY

text: for the remainder of the current license period.
label: BODY

text: Page 24
label: BODY

text: (5) An applicant may request a refund for initial
label: BODY

text: licensure as follows:
label: BODY

text: (a) Two-thirds of the initial fee paid after the
label: BODY

text: department has received an application and not conducted an
label: BODY

text: on-site survey or provided technical assistance; or
label: BODY

text: (b) One-third of the initial fee paid after the
label: BODY

text: department has received an application and conducted either
label: BODY

text: an on-site survey or provided technical assistance but not
label: BODY

text: issued a license.
label: BODY

text: WAC 246-XXX-200 Pharmaceutical Services.  This section
label: HH1

text: assures patient pharmaceutical needs are met in a planned
label: BODY

text: and organized manner. This section is consistent with the
label: BODY

text: requirements for a health care entity license under RCW
label: BODY

text: 18,46.450 and Chapter 246-904 WAC.
label: BODY

text: An ambulatory surgical facility must:
label: BODY

text: (1) Designate a pharmacist in charge who is licensed
label: BODY

text: in Washington State and responsible to:
label: BODY

text: (a) Assure drugs are stored, compounded, delivered or
label: BODY

text: dispensed according to all applicable state and federal
label: BODY

text: rules and regulations,
label: BODY

text: (b) Create and implement policy and procedures related
label: BODY

text: to:
label: BODY

text: (i) Purchasing, ordering, storing, compounding,
label: BODY

text: delivering, dispensing and administering of controlled
label: BODY

text: substances or legend drugs;
label: BODY

text: (ii) Maintaining accurate inventory records and
label: BODY

text: patient medical records related to the administration of
label: BODY

text: controlled substances and legend drugs;
label: BODY

text: (iii)Maintaining any other records required by state
label: BODY

text: and federal regulations;
label: BODY

text: (iv) Security of legend drugs and controlled
label: BODY

text: substances; and
label: BODY

text: (v) Controlling access to controlled substances and
label: BODY

text: legend drugs.
label: BODY

text: (c) Execute all forms for the purchase and order of
label: BODY

text: legend drugs and controlled substances, and
label: BODY

text: (d) Verify receipt of all legend drugs and controlled
label: BODY

text: substances purchased and ordered by the ambulatory surgical
label: BODY

text: facility.
label: BODY

text: NOTE: The pharmacist in charge can be either employed
label: BODY

text: by the facility or be a pharmacy consultant.
label: BODY

text: (2) Only administer, dispense or deliver legend drugs
label: BODY

text: and controlled substances to patients receiving care in the
label: BODY

text: facility;
label: BODY

text: Page 25
label: BODY

text: (3) Assure drugs dispensed to patients are dispensed
label: BODY

text: and labeled consistent with the requirements of RCW
label: BODY

text: 18.64.264, and Chapters 69.41 and 69.50 RCW; and
label: BODY

text: (4) Establish and use a process for selecting
label: BODY

text: medications based on evaluating their relative therapeutic
label: BODY

text: merits, safety, and cost.
label: BODY

text: WAC 246-XXX-205 Patient Care Services.  This section
label: HH1

text: guides the development of a plan for patient care.  This is
label: BODY

text: accomplished by supervising staff, establishing,
label: BODY

text: monitoring, and enforcing policies and procedures that
label: BODY

text: define and outline the use of materials, resources, and
label: BODY

text: promote the delivery of care.
label: BODY

text: An ambulatory surgical facility must:
label: BODY

text: (1) Provide personnel, space, equipment, reference
label: BODY

text: materials, training, and supplies for the appropriate care
label: BODY

text: and treatment of patients;
label: BODY

text: (2) Have a registered nurse available for consultation
label: BODY

text: in the ambulatory surgical facility at all times patients
label: BODY

text: are present;
label: BODY

text: (3) Adopt, implement, review and revise patient care
label: BODY

text: policies and procedures designed to guide staff that
label: BODY

text: address:
label: BODY

text: (a) Criteria for patient admission;
label: BODY

text: (b) Reliable method for personal identification of
label: BODY

text: each patient;
label: BODY

text: (c) Conditions that require patient transfer to
label: BODY

text: outside facilities;
label: BODY

text: (d) Patient safety measures;
label: BODY

text: (e) Staff access to patient care areas;
label: BODY

text: (f) Use of physical and chemical restraints or
label: BODY

text: seclusion consistent with CFR 42.482;
label: BODY

text: (g) Use of pre established patient care guidelines or
label: BODY

text: protocols.  When used, these must be documented in the
label: BODY

text: medical record and be pre approved or authenticated by an
label: BODY

text: authorized practitioner or advanced registered nurse
label: BODY

text: practitioner;
label: BODY

text: (h) Care and handling of patients whose condition
label: BODY

text: require special medical or medical-legal consideration;
label: BODY

text: (i) Preparation and administration of blood and blood
label: BODY

text: products; and
label: BODY

text: (j) Discharge planning.
label: BODY

text: (4) Have a system to plan and document care in an
label: BODY

text: interdisciplinary manner, including:
label: BODY

text: (a) Development of an individualized patient plan of
label: BODY

text: Page 26
label: BODY

text: care, based on an initial assessment;
label: BODY

text: (b) Assessment for risk of falls, skin condition,
label: BODY

text: pressure ulcers, pain, medication use, therapeutic effects
label: BODY

text: and side or adverse effects.
label: BODY

text: (5) Complete and document an initial assessment of
label: BODY

text: each patient's physical condition, emotional, and social
label: BODY

text: needs in the medical record.  Initial assessment includes:
label: BODY

text: (a) Dependent upon the procedure and the risk of harm
label: BODY

text: or injury, a patient history and physical assessment
label: BODY

text: including but not limited to falls, mental status and skin
label: BODY

text: condition;
label: BODY

text: (b) Current needs;
label: BODY

text: (c) Need for discharge planning;
label: BODY

text: (d) When treating pediatric patients, the immunization
label: BODY

text: status;
label: BODY

text: (e) Physical examination, if within thirty days prior
label: BODY

text: to admission, and updated as needed if patient status has
label: BODY

text: changed; and
label: BODY

text: (f) Discharge plans when appropriate, coordinated
label: BODY

text: with:
label: BODY

text: (i) Patient, family or caregiver; and
label: BODY

text: (ii) Receiving agency, when necessary.
label: BODY

text: WAC 246-XXX-210 Surgical Services.  The purpose of
label: HH1

text: this section is to guide the development and management of
label: BODY

text: surgical services.
label: BODY

text: An ambulatory surgical facility must:
label: BODY

text: (1) Adopt and implement policies and procedures that:
label: BODY

text: (a) Identify areas where surgery and invasive
label: BODY

text: procedures may be performed;
label: BODY

text: (b) Define staff access to areas where surgery and
label: BODY

text: invasive procedures are performed;
label: BODY

text: (c) Identify practitioner and advanced registered
label: BODY

text: nurse practitioner's privileges for operating room staff,
label: BODY

text: and
label: BODY

text: (d) Define staff qualifications and oversight;
label: BODY

text: (2) Use facility policies and procedures which define
label: BODY

text: standards of care;
label: BODY

text: (3) Implement a system to identify and indicate the
label: BODY

text: correct surgical site prior to beginning a surgical
label: BODY

text: procedure.
label: BODY

text: (4) Timely provide emergency equipment, supplies, and
label: BODY

text: services to surgical and invasive areas;
label: BODY

text: Page 27
label: BODY

text: (5) Provide separate refrigerated storage equipment
label: BODY

text: with temperature alarms, when blood is stored in the
label: BODY

text: surgical department and
label: BODY

text: (6) Assure either
label: BODY

text: (a) A registered nurse qualified by training and
label: BODY

text: experience; or
label: BODY

text: (b) An ACLS-certified licensed practical nurse
label: BODY

text: supervised by an immediately available ACLS-certified
label: BODY

text: registered nurse or physician functions as the circulating
label: BODY

text: nurse in every operating room during surgical procedures.
label: BODY

text: WAC 246-XXX-215 Anesthesia services.  The purpose of
label: HH1

text: this section is to guide the management and care of
label: BODY

text: patients receiving anesthesia.
label: BODY

text: An ambulatory surgical facility must:
label: BODY

text: (1) Adopt and implement policies and procedures that:
label: BODY

text: (a) Identify the types of anesthesia that may be used;
label: BODY

text: (b) Identify areas where each type of anesthesia may
label: BODY

text: be used; and
label: BODY

text: (c) Define the staff qualifications and oversight for
label: BODY

text: administering each type of anesthesia used in the facility;
label: BODY

text: (2) Use facility policies and procedures which define
label: BODY

text: standards of care;
label: BODY

text: (3) Assure emergency equipment, supplies and services
label: BODY

text: are immediately available in all areas where anesthesia is
label: BODY

text: used.
label: BODY

text: WAC 246-XXX-220 Recovery Care.  The purpose of this
label: HH1

text: section is to guide the management of patients recovering
label: BODY

text: from anesthesia and sedation.
label: BODY

text: An ambulatory surgical facility must:
label: BODY

text: (1) Adopt and implement policies and procedures that
label: BODY

text: define the qualifications and oversight of staff delivering
label: BODY

text: recovery services;
label: BODY

text: (2) Assure a physician or advanced registered nurse
label: BODY

text: practitioner capable of managing complications and
label: BODY

text: providing cardiopulmonary resuscitation is immediately
label: BODY

text: available for patients recovering from anesthesia; and
label: BODY

text: (3) Assure a registered nurse trained and current in
label: BODY

text: advanced cardiac life support measures is immediately
label: BODY

text: available for patients recovering from anesthesia.
label: BODY

text: Page 28
label: BODY

text: WAC 246-XXX-225 Emergency services.  The purpose of
label: BODY

text: this section is to guide the management and care of
label: BODY

text: patients receiving emergency services.
label: BODY

text: An ambulatory surgical facility must:
label: BODY

text: (1) Develop, implement and maintain a facility safety
label: BODY

text: and emergency training program that includes:
label: BODY

text: (a) On-site equipment, medication and trained
label: BODY

text: personnel to manage any medical emergency that may arise
label: BODY

text: from the services provided or sought;
label: BODY

text: (b) A written and signed transfer agreement with one
label: BODY

text: or more local hospitals that has been approved by the
label: BODY

text: ambulatory surgical facility’s medical staff; and
label: BODY

text: (c)Policies and a procedural plan for handling medical
label: BODY

text: emergencies;
label: BODY

text: (d) Define the qualifications and oversight of staff
label: BODY

text: delivering emergency care services;
label: BODY

text: (2) Assure at least one registered nurse skilled and
label: BODY

text: trained in emergency care services on duty and in the
label: BODY

text: ambulatory surgical facility at all times a patient is
label: BODY

text: present, who is:
label: BODY

text: (a) Immediately available to provide care; and
label: BODY

text: (b) Trained and current in advanced cardiac life
label: BODY

text: support.
label: BODY

text: (3) Assure communication with agencies and health care
label: BODY

text: providers as indicated by patient condition; and
label: BODY

text: (4) Assure emergency equipment, supplies and services
label: BODY

text: necessary to meet the needs of patients are immediately
label: BODY

text: available.
label: BODY

text: Part II – Environment of Care
label: BODY

text: WAC 246-XXX-230 Management of environment for care.
label: HH1

text: The purpose of this section is to manage environmental
label: BODY

text: hazards and risks, prevent accidents and injuries, and
label: BODY

text: maintain safe conditions for patients, visitors, and staff.
label: BODY

text: (1) An ambulatory surgical facility must create and
label: BODY

text: follow an environment of care management plan that
label: BODY

text: addresses safety, security, hazardous materials and waste,
label: BODY

text: emergency preparedness, fire safety, medical equipment,
label: BODY

text: utility systems and physical environment.
label: BODY

text: (2) An ambulatory surgical facility must assure the
label: BODY

text: environment of care management plan contains the follow
label: BODY

text: items:
label: BODY

text: (a) Safety:
label: BODY

text: (i) Policies and procedures on safety related issues
label: BODY

text: Page 29
label: BODY

text: such as but not limited to physical hazards and injury
label: BODY

text: prevention;
label: BODY

text: (ii) Method to educate and periodically review with
label: BODY

text: staff the safety policies and procedures;
label: BODY

text: (iii) Process to investigate, correct and report
label: BODY

text: safety related incidents; and
label: BODY

text: (iv) Process to keep the physical environment free of
label: BODY

text: hazards.
label: BODY

text: (b) Security:
label: BODY

text: (i) Policies and procedures to protect patients,
label: BODY

text: visitors, and staff while in the facility including
label: BODY

text: preventing patient abduction;
label: BODY

text: (ii) Method to educate and periodically review
label: BODY

text: security policies and procedures with staff; and
label: BODY

text: (iii) When the facility has security staff, train the
label: BODY

text: security staff to a level of skill and competency for their
label: BODY

text: assigned responsibility.
label: BODY

text: (c) Hazardous materials and waste:
label: BODY

text: (i) Establish and implement a program to safely
label: BODY

text: control hazardous materials and waste according to federal,
label: BODY

text: state, and local regulations;
label: BODY

text: (ii) Provide space and equipment for safe handling and
label: BODY

text: storage of hazardous materials and waste;
label: BODY

text: (iii) Process to investigate all hazardous material or
label: BODY

text: waste spills, exposures, and other incidents, and report as
